image.alt: Gordon Orthodontics team and office, welcoming patients with bright smiles

paragraphs.text: Gordon Orthodontics delivers modern, compassionate orthodontic care in a clean, welcoming office, combining up‑to‑date technologies such as iTero digital scanning and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> with careful infection control and patient‑focused service for kids, teens, and adults.
We make treatment comfortable and convenient with flexible scheduling, straightforward financing options, and a friendly team that treats every patient like family.

items.title: Modern Office
items.text: Brand‑new, comfortable environment kept clean and welcoming for patients and families.

items.title: Digital Technology
items.text: We offer Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and iTero digital scanning for faster, more discreet treatment.

items.title: Flexible Financing
items.text: Straightforward fees and payment plans designed to fit family budgets.

items.title: Experienced Care
items.text: Individualized, patient‑centered treatment for children, teens, and adults with efficient scheduling.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Colleen Gordon, Orthodontist, provides individualized care for patients of all ages at Gordon Orthodontics in Ambler, PA. She completed her undergraduate studies in chemistry at Temple University, earned her DDS from Temple University’s School of Dentistry, and completed a Masters in Orthodontics at Saint Louis University. Dr. Gordon combines advanced training with a warm, patient‑focused approach to create comfortable, confident smiles.

image.alt: Dr. Colleen Gordon at Gordon Orthodontics in Ambler, PA

paragraphs.text: We offer personalized treatment plans using the latest techniques, from clear aligners to traditional braces and retainers to help maintain your results.

image.alt: Surgical orthodontics and complex case coordination

testimonials.author: Valerie
testimonials.testimonial: "Dr. Colleen made my son feel so at ease! She is very knowledgeable and super friendly! The office is bright and cheerful. Nicole, the receptionist, is also very friendly and knowledgeable. I would recommend this orthodontist to anyone in the area!"

testimonials.author: Michael
testimonials.testimonial: "Absolutely the best orthodontist in the Philadelphia /Southern NJ area. Colleen is equipped with great knowledge and skills and compassion for her patients. As a referring dentist, all my patients speak extremely highly of her. You won’t be disappointed!"

testimonials.author: Maura
testimonials.testimonial: "Dr. Gordon was very knowledgable, professional, & offered practical approaches that addressed my concerns. In addition, her office is kept sparkling clean and is filled with the most up to date equipment. Overall, the office makes scheduling, consultation, and treatment super easy & affordable!"

testimonials.author: Julie
testimonials.testimonial: "I highly recommend Dr. Colleen Gordon for any and all orthodontic needs. Dr. Gordon is very approachable and explains things clearly. Her appointments are highly efficient and she ensures you feel comfortable the whole time."

og_meta.description: Gordon Orthodontics in Ambler, PA offers modern orthodontic care for kids, teens, and adults. Call (267) 360-0777 to schedule.

image.alt: Bright, welcoming orthodontic office interior with comfortable seating and warm lighting

paragraphs.text: At Gordon Orthodontics, we work to create beautiful, healthy smiles in a comfortable, family-oriented environment. From the moment you arrive our team greets you with warmth and clear communication so every visit feels easy and personal.

Dr. Colleen takes pride in not only delivering smiles her patients will love, but also building relationships with each person and their family. She sees patients at every visit, explains treatment options clearly, and answers questions so families feel confident about care.

We offer modern treatment choices, including clear aligners and braces, supported by digital records and the latest technology to make visits faster and more comfortable. Our goal is simple: "we want you to LOVE YOUR SMILE!"

With flexible scheduling, friendly staff, and a focus on gentle, individualized care, we help patients of all ages find the right treatment path and leave our office feeling supported and ready to smile.

image.alt: Dr. Colleen Gordon smiling at Gordon Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: At Gordon Orthodontics, you will love your smile. Dr. Colleen brings a patient-first approach to every appointment, taking time to review medical and dental history, perform a thorough exam, and explain individualized treatment options. She performs complimentary consultations and meets personally with patients to walk through digital records and proposed plans.
Patients appreciate Dr. Colleen's clear explanations and attentive manner. She prioritizes comfort and long-term results, building trusting relationships so families feel informed at every step.

Dr. Colleen completed undergraduate studies in Chemistry at Temple University and earned her dental degree from Temple University’s School of Dentistry, graduating with high honors and membership in Omicron Kappa Upsilon. She continued specialty training with a Master of Science in Orthodontics from Saint Louis University, where she refined advanced techniques and treatment strategies.

image.alt: Dr. Colleen Gordon smiling in the treatment room

paragraphs.text: Raised locally, Dr. Colleen returned to serve Ambler and the surrounding communities. Outside the office she enjoys time with her husband Alex, their children Emma and Connor, family dog Blue, and hobbies like baking, travel, and running. She looks forward to giving back to the community, one smile at a time.

image.alt: Dr. Colleen Gordon smiling and interacting with a patient
iTero digital scanner used for orthodontic records

paragraphs.text: Complimentary consultations include a review of dental and medical history, a thorough oral exam, and digital records to create a personalized plan. Dr. Colleen reviews options in plain language so families can choose the treatment that best fits their needs and lifestyle.

image.alt: Private consultation room at Gordon Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We use modern digital tools, including the iTero scanner, to take accurate records without messy impressions. Digital workflows speed treatment planning and enhance comfort while helping patients visualize expected results.

We offer flexible scheduling with early and evening appointments, collaborative care with general dentists, and a range of payment options including 0% financing to help families fit orthodontics into their budget.

Get Started.title: What to Expect at Your First Visit

paragraphs.text: We can’t wait to welcome you to our office. Your complimentary consultation with Dr. Colleen Gordon includes a review of your dental and medical history, a thorough oral exam, and orthodontic records with digital X-rays and photographs.

We will discuss individualized treatment options, review financial and insurance information, and answer all your questions. If you decide to start treatment, we’ll schedule a 3D iTero scan and, in many cases, place appliances at that visit to minimize appointments.

image.alt: Smiling friends at Gordon Orthodontics in Ambler, PA

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will file your claims electronically for maximum convenience.

Flexible payment plans and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> financing are available; most major credit cards are accepted. Schedule a free consultation so we can review options and build a payment plan that fits your budget.
Please complete the following patient forms prior to your first visit. Filling them out in advance helps us verify your insurance benefits and speeds the check-in process.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms

seo.page_description: Start your orthodontic journey with Gordon Orthodontics. Learn what to expect, complete new patient forms, and schedule a free consultation online or by phone.
seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, new patient, forms, consultation, Gordon Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Get Started | Gordon Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic journey with Gordon Orthodontics. Learn what to expect, complete new patient forms, and schedule a free consultation online or by phone.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Traditional metal braces remain a reliable choice. Modern brackets are smaller and more comfortable, made from high-grade metal alloys that move teeth efficiently. Many patients personalize their look with colored elastics.
Ceramic braces blend with tooth color for a less noticeable option. They work like traditional braces but require careful hygiene, since elastic ties can stain between visits.

Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a series of clear, removable aligners customized from 3D scans. Many adults choose it for its discreet appearance, comfort, and the ability to eat and clean without bracket restrictions.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Invisalign Teen offers clear, removable aligners made for an active lifestyle. They’re comfortable, durable, and let teens eat freely and play sports without brackets getting in the way.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Lingual braces are placed on the tongue side of the teeth, making them invisible from the front. They are fully customized to your bite using modern digital workflows and provide an option when aligners aren’t suitable.

image.alt: Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology

paragraphs.text: Retainers protect your new alignment. We offer both removable and fixed options with guidance on wear; typically full-time wear for about six months, then nighttime wear indefinitely to preserve results.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Early evaluation helps identify growth issues so timely intervention can guide jaw development and often prevent more complex problems. In many cases early work shortens or simplifies the comprehensive treatment needed later.

When jaw discrepancies require more than tooth movement alone, surgical orthodontics combines careful orthodontic planning with oral and maxillofacial surgery to restore function and facial balance. We collaborate closely with surgeons to coordinate care.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about orthodontic treatment, scheduling, insurance, payments, and retainers at Gordon Orthodontics.

accordion.header: What is the difference between an orthodontist and a dentist?

paragraphs.text: An orthodontist is a general dentist that has had at least 2 more years of full-time training in orthodontics resulting in a nationally accepted specialty certificate. The orthodontist then limits their practice to straightening teeth and dentofacial orthopedics.

accordion.header: Can I make all my appointments in the afternoon after school and late in the day?

paragraphs.text: In order to have early and late appointments available for the majority of patient appointments, some procedures need to be accomplished during the hours of 9 and 3. We will do our best to work with your schedules and accommodate your family needs.

accordion.header: Do you see patients for emergencies?

paragraphs.text: Yes, our contact information for an emergency is posted on the website. Feel free to visit our emergency care page for more information.

Yes. Whether or not you have insurance or a dental plan, we will structure a convenient payment plan that will allow you to pay for orthodontic services over a period of time that usually coincides with your treatment plan. Learn more here.

After verification of coverage, we will agree to bill and collect from an insurance carrier. However, we ask patients to understand that if coverage ceases or changes, the patient is still responsible for the agreed upon fee.

accordion.header: Do you take American Express, Master Card and/or Visa?

paragraphs.text: Yes, we accept all major credit cards.
Yes, we have arrangements for direct debit, charge card posting, as well as payments over the internet.
No we do not.
We have special programs and fees for multiple patients from the same family.

accordion.header: Do I need to be pre-medicated for the dentist. Do I need to take my medicine for the orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: Yes.

accordion.header: Do retainers need to be worn after braces?

paragraphs.text: Yes, retainers are worn full-time for about 6 months followed by nighttime wear indefinitely.

accordion.header: Why do teeth get crooked after wearing braces or aligners?

paragraphs.text: Teeth move throughout life whether you have worn braces or not. It is part of the natural aging process. This is why retainer wear is recommended indefinitely to maintain your orthodontic results over your lifetime.
